languages.text: {n}Медикарий утомленно морщится.{/n} "Как и фактическую редкость чудес. Вера, что молитвой можно избавиться от хвори, растит ложные надежды. Те, кто предпочитает лечиться молитвой, все равно попадают на мой стол — но уже для вскрытия, а не для операции".

{n}He grimaces wearily.{/n} "And neither can one deny the fact that miracles are rare. The belief that prayer can relieve a person of illness enables false hopes. Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."
languages.original_text: {n}Медикарий утомленно морщится.{/n} "Как и фактическую редкость чудес. Вера, что молитвой можно избавиться от хвори, растит ложные надежды. Те, кто предпочитает лечиться молитвой, все равно попадают на мой стол — но уже для вскрытия, а не для операции".

Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."

Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."

Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."

Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."

Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."

{n}He grimaces wearily.{/n} "And neither can one deny the fact that miracles are rare. The belief that prayer can relieve a person of illness enables false hopes. Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."

languages.text: {n}Er verzieht das Gesicht.{/n} "Und ebenso kann niemand bestreiten, dass Wunder selten sind. Die Annahme, ein Gebet könne eine Krankheit heilen, weckt falsche Hoffnungen. Wer es vorzieht, sich mit andächtigen Worten selbst zu heilen, landet letztlich doch auf meinem Tisch ... wobei ich dann meist nur noch eine Autopsie vornehmen muss."
languages.original_text: {n}He grimaces wearily.{/n} "And neither can one deny the fact that miracles are rare. The belief that prayer can relieve a person of illness enables false hopes. Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."

traits.locale_text: {n}Er verzieht das Gesicht.{/n} "Und ebenso kann niemand bestreiten, dass Wunder selten sind. Die Annahme, ein Gebet könne eine Krankheit heilen, weckt falsche Hoffnungen. Wer es vorzieht, sich mit andächtigen Worten selbst zu heilen, landet letztlich doch auf meinem Tisch ... wobei ich dann meist nur noch eine Autopsie vornehmen muss."

languages.text: {n}Il grimace d'un air las.{/n} « Et il est tout aussi indéniable que les miracles sont chose rare. La croyance en de prétendues vertus curatives de la prière ne fait qu'alimenter de faux espoirs. Ceux qui cherchent à se soigner par des mots sacrés finissent invariablement sur ma table... en vue d'une autopsie plutôt souvent que pour une opération. »
languages.original_text: {n}He grimaces wearily.{/n} "And neither can one deny the fact that miracles are rare. The belief that prayer can relieve a person of illness enables false hopes. Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."

traits.locale_text: {n}Il grimace d'un air las.{/n} « Et il est tout aussi indéniable que les miracles sont chose rare. La croyance en de prétendues vertus curatives de la prière ne fait qu'alimenter de faux espoirs. Ceux qui cherchent à se soigner par des mots sacrés finissent invariablement sur ma table... en vue d'une autopsie plutôt souvent que pour une opération. »

languages.text: {n}Hace una mueca de hastío.{/n} «También es innegable el hecho de que los milagros son poco habituales. Creer que la oración es capaz de aliviar las dolencias de una persona alimenta vanas esperanzas. Quienes prefieren tratarse con rezos acaban igualmente sobre mi mesa, pero en su caso lo que practico es una autopsia y no una intervención».
languages.original_text: {n}He grimaces wearily.{/n} "And neither can one deny the fact that miracles are rare. The belief that prayer can relieve a person of illness enables false hopes. Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."

traits.locale_text: {n}Hace una mueca de hastío.{/n} «También es innegable el hecho de que los milagros son poco habituales. Creer que la oración es capaz de aliviar las dolencias de una persona alimenta vanas esperanzas. Quienes prefieren tratarse con rezos acaban igualmente sobre mi mesa, pero en su caso lo que practico es una autopsia y no una intervención».

languages.text: {n}彼は疲れたように苦笑する。{/n}「奇跡は滅多に起きないという事実を否定することもできません。祈れば病気が治るという信仰は、偽りの希望を抱かせます。敬虔な言葉で自らを癒すことを選ぶ人たちは、それでも最終的に私のベッドの上にやってくるのです…手術ではなく、解剖を行うために」
languages.original_text: {n}He grimaces wearily.{/n} "And neither can one deny the fact that miracles are rare. The belief that prayer can relieve a person of illness enables false hopes. Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."

traits.locale_text: {n}彼は疲れたように苦笑する。{/n}「奇跡は滅多に起きないという事実を否定することもできません。祈れば病気が治るという信仰は、偽りの希望を抱かせます。敬虔な言葉で自らを癒すことを選ぶ人たちは、それでも最終的に私のベッドの上にやってくるのです…手術ではなく、解剖を行うために」

languages.text: {n}他疲惫地皱了皱眉头。{/n}“奇迹是极为罕见的事情，这一点也不能否认。那些人以为光靠祈祷就能把病治好，这给那些病人带来了虚假的希望。至于那些打算靠祈祷治病，不肯接受治疗的人，最终还是会出现在我的手术台上。不过，那就不是做手术了，而是做尸检。”
languages.original_text: {n}He grimaces wearily.{/n} "And neither can one deny the fact that miracles are rare. The belief that prayer can relieve a person of illness enables false hopes. Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."

traits.locale_text: {n}他疲惫地皱了皱眉头。{/n}“奇迹是极为罕见的事情，这一点也不能否认。那些人以为光靠祈祷就能把病治好，这给那些病人带来了虚假的希望。至于那些打算靠祈祷治病，不肯接受治疗的人，最终还是会出现在我的手术台上。不过，那就不是做手术了，而是做尸检。”

languages.text: {n}Bitkin bir edayla yüzünü buruşturuyor.{/n} "Mucizelerin nadir olduğu gerçeği de kimse inkâr edilemez. Duanın bir insanın hastalığını giderebileceğine dair inanç, sahte umutlara neden olur. Dinî sözcüklerle iyileşmeyi tercih edenler de nihayetinde kendilerini benim masamda bulur. Tedavi değil, otopsi gerçekleştirmem için ama."
languages.original_text: {n}He grimaces wearily.{/n} "And neither can one deny the fact that miracles are rare. The belief that prayer can relieve a person of illness enables false hopes. Those who prefer healing themselves with reverent words still end up on my table — so that I can perform an autopsy rather than a procedure."
